GFS Wrapper for Regression Runs relatively simple regression analysis

gfs_svyglm.Rd

#' When robust.huberM is TRUE, for (approximately) continuous outcomes, you have the option of alternatively using a "robust m-estimator" with Huber style robustness weights in addition to the complex sampling design adjustments. It's unknown whether this makes a meaningful difference, but preliminary testing suggests small differences in point estimates but sometimes dramatic changes to standard errors for reasons that are unclear to me. Could be due to a strange interaction of robustness weights, attrition weights, and post-stratified sampling weights.

Usage

gfs_svyglm(
  formula,
  svy.design,
  family = gaussian(),
  robust.huberM = FALSE,
  robust.tune = 1,
  ...
)

Arguments

formula

a model (linear) as used in glm

svy.design

a data.frame or survey.design object

family

the usual family argument as used in glms see below for more information

robust.huberM

a logical defining whether to use the robsurvey pacakge to estimate the linear regression model instead of the usual svyglm(.) function (default: FALSE)

robust.tune

(default 1) tuning parameter for robsurvey package

...

additional arguments as needed

Value

a list of containing resulting fitted object (fit), residuals, a tidied version, and a vector containing the included predictor variables.

Examples

{
  # TO-DO
}
#> NULL
